meanings.definition: A person who uses a net to catch fish or other animals.
meanings.sent1: The netters at the lake caught many fish for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The skilled netters easily caught the butterflies in their net.
meanings.sent3: The netters were so good at catching fish, they even caught a rubber duck by mistake!
meanings.sent4: She was a netter in the sea of life, catching opportunities as they swam by.
meanings.sent5: The netters' hands moved swiftly, capturing the essence of the underwater world.

meanings.definition: A person who is skilled at using a net in sports such as volleyball or tennis.
meanings.sent1: The netters in the volleyball team never missed a ball.
meanings.sent2: The skilled netters won the tennis match with their precise moves.
meanings.sent3: The netters in the tennis game were like graceful dancers on the court.
meanings.sent4: She was a netter in the game of life, always aiming for the perfect shot.
meanings.sent5: The netters' teamwork was like a well-choreographed dance, each move perfectly timed.
